info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 28 at 12:56PM MDT by NWS GrandJunction
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southwestern Garfield and southeastern Uintah Counties through 130 PM MDT... At 1255 PM MDT, satellite imagery indicated a strong thunderstorm 34 miles northwest of Fruita, or 43 miles northwest of Grand Junction, moving southeast at 20 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Satellite indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This storm will remain over mainly rural areas of southwestern Garfield and southeastern Uintah Counties. This includes Colorado 139 mile marker 31 and near mile marker 33. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
